metadata.title: Solaris 8 kcms_configure Command-Line Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: kcms_configure as included with Solaris 7 and 8 allows a local attacker to gain additional privileges via a buffer overflow in a command line argument.

criteria.comment: File kcms_configure executable and SUID or SGID

criterion.comment: File kcms_configure executable and SUID or SGID

criteria.comment: File kcms_configure executable and SUID or SGID

criterion.comment: File kcms_configure executable and SUID or SGID
File kcms_configure executable and SUID or SGID

metadata.title: Heap Overflow in Solaris 8 xlock
metadata.description: Heap overflow in xlock in Solaris 2.6 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long (1) XFILESEARCHPATH or (2) XUSERFILESEARCHPATH environmental variable.

metadata.title: String Format Vulnerability in Solaris 8 snmpdx
metadata.description: Format string vulnerability in the logging component of snmpdx for Solaris 5.6 through 8 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: Sun Solaris 8 XSun Color Database File Heap Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Xsun on Solaris 2.6 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long -co (color database) command line argument.

metadata.title: Sun Solaris 7 XSun Color Database File Heap Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Xsun on Solaris 2.6 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long -co (color database) command line argument.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 whodo Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in whodo in Solaris SunOS 5.5.1 through 5.8 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long (1) SOR or (2) CFIME environment variable.

modified.comment: Fixed obj:1742: moved regexp terminal anchor from filename to path.
Replaced reference to obj:1740 with obj:1742, which is more correct, and fixed test comment.
Fixed tst:3041: Replaced reference to obj:1740 with obj:1742, which is more correct, and fixed test comment. Note previous edit was to tst:3040.
Fixed criterion comments.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 cachefsd Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the fscache_setup function of cachefsd in Solaris 2.6, 7, and 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long mount argument.

modified.comment: Updated to add patch test
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 whodo Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in whodo in Solaris SunOS 5.5.1 through 5.8 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long (1) SOR or (2) CFIME environment variable.

modified.comment: Fixed obj:1742: moved regexp terminal anchor from filename to path.
Replaced reference to obj:1740 with obj:1742, which is more correct, and fixed test comment.
Fixed tst:3041: Replaced reference to obj:1740 with obj:1742, which is more correct, and fixed test comment. Note previous edit was to tst:3040.
Fixed criterion comments.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 AdminTool Media Installation Path Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in admintool in Solaris 2.6, 7, and 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long media installation path.

modified.comment: modified uft-15 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly.

modified upt-845 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly. Also modified to test for both SUID and OEXEC bits, so a second test is not needed.
Removed compound test for "admintool SUID and executable" because new version of upt-845 does both.
Fixed obj:1726, which had been badly mangled during conversion from OVAL 4.2 to 5.0. Operation set to pattern match on path, and terminal regexp anchor moved from filename to path.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 rpc.yppasswdd Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in rpc.yppasswdd (yppasswd server) in Solaris 2.6, 7 and 8 allows remote attackers to gain root access via a long username.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 AdminTool Media Installation Path Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in admintool in Solaris 2.6, 7, and 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long media installation path.

modified.comment: modified uft-15 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly.

modified upt-845 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly. Also modified to test for both SUID and OEXEC bits, so a second test is not needed.
Removed compound test for "admintool SUID and executable" because new version of upt-845 does both.
Fixed obj:1726, which had been badly mangled during conversion from OVAL 4.2 to 5.0. Operation set to pattern match on path, and terminal regexp anchor moved from filename to path.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 mibiisa Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the MIB parsing component of mibiisa for Solaris 5.6 through 8 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges.

metadata.description: kcms_configure as included with Solaris 7 and 8 allows a local attacker to gain additional privileges via a buffer overflow in a command line argument.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 admintool Local Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in admintool in Solaris 2.5 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via long arguments to (1) the -d command line option, or (2) the PRODVERS argument in the .cdtoc file.

modified.comment: modified uft-15 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly.

modified upt-845 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly. Also modified to test for both SUID and OEXEC bits, so a second test is not needed.
Removed compound test for "admintool SUID and executable" because new version of upt-845 does both.
Fixed obj:1726, which had been badly mangled during conversion from OVAL 4.2 to 5.0. Operation set to pattern match on path, and terminal regexp anchor moved from filename to path.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 admintool Local Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in admintool in Solaris 2.5 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via long arguments to (1) the -d command line option, or (2) the PRODVERS argument in the .cdtoc file.

modified.comment: modified uft-15 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly.

modified upt-845 - admintool is either /bin/admintool or /usr/bin/admintool (or both). Regular expression had been ^.*/bin/admintool$, which could cause arbitrary-depth search. Changed to ^(/usr)?/bin/admintool$, which bounds the search properly. Also modified to test for both SUID and OEXEC bits, so a second test is not needed.
Removed compound test for "admintool SUID and executable" because new version of upt-845 does both.
Fixed obj:1726, which had been badly mangled during conversion from OVAL 4.2 to 5.0. Operation set to pattern match on path, and terminal regexp anchor moved from filename to path.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 CDE dtspcd Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the client connection routine of libDtSvc.so.1 in CDE Subprocess Control Service (dtspcd) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 CDE dtspcd Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the client connection routine of libDtSvc.so.1 in CDE Subprocess Control Service (dtspcd) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 LBXProxy Display Name Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Low BandWidth X proxy (lbxproxy) in Solaris 8 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long display command line option.

metadata.title: Solaris 8 mibiisa Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the MIB parsing component of mibiisa for Solaris 5.6 through 8 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: Solaris cachefsd Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the fscache_setup function of cachefsd in Solaris 2.6, 7, and 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long mount argument.

modified.comment: Updated to add patch test
Added Solaris 9 and Solaris 9 patch test to the definition
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 rpc.yppasswdd Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in rpc.yppasswdd (yppasswd server) in Solaris 2.6, 7 and 8 allows remote attackers to gain root access via a long username.

metadata.title: String Format Vulnerability in Solaris 7 snmpdx
metadata.description: Format string vulnerability in the logging component of snmpdx for Solaris 5.6 through 8 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 cachefsd Heap Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in cfsd_calloc function of Solaris cachefsd allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a request with a long directory and cache name.

modified.comment: Added patch test
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Heap Overflow in Solaris 7 xlock
metadata.description: Heap overflow in xlock in Solaris 2.6 through 8 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long (1) XFILESEARCHPATH or (2) XUSERFILESEARCHPATH environmental variable.

metadata.title: Solaris 7 LBXProxy Display Name Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Low BandWidth X proxy (lbxproxy) in Solaris 8 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long display command line option.
